snippet: National signing day, when high school football stars reveal commitments to college programs, has evolved into hours of unmatched pageantry, with elaborate staged announcements and comic gimmicks.
abstract: Marc Tracy on College Football column on national signing day, biggest day of the year for college football fans; notes Southern California secured seven top-ranked players in California and Texas A&M was able to hold on to quarterback Kyler Murray despite late effort from Texas.
lead_paragraph: National signing day, when high school football stars reveal commitments to college programs, has evolved into hours of unmatched pageantry, with elaborate staged announcements and comic gimmicks.

headline.seo: National Signing Day, When College Football Makes a Spectacle of Itself
headline.main: A Day of Grand Displays, but the Pen Is Mightiest
headline.print_headline: A Day of Grand Displays, but the Pen Is Mightiest
